entry.title: 532: We Like Snaps Now
entry.summary: Has Canonical finally nailed snaps? Why it looks like Ubuntu has turned a new corner; our thoughts on the latest release. Plus, a special guest and more.

entry.title: 539: Mike Breaks the Build
entry.summary: Mike checks in from the grind and shares some challenges in recent cross-platform testing; then, we get into the avalanche of negative AI press coverage this week and the one massive story they're not touching.

entry.title: 531: The Windows Challenge
entry.summary: We ran Windows for the week with three seemingly simple objectives. How we did, our take on what's gotten a lot better about Windows, and what still needs some work.

entry.title: 538: You Never Forget Your First
entry.summary: How does your first major programming language/technology still shape your work and career? Then grab some popcorn and let's watch the next epic tech titan battle unfold.

entry.title: 530: Leave the Pi in the Oven
entry.summary: Why the Raspberry Pi 5 doesn't meet our expectations, and the x86 boxes you should consider instead.

entry.title: 537: Unity Mutiny
entry.summary: Our unique take on the Unity outrage, thoughts on RustRover, and Mike shares a very annoying mistake.

entry.title: 529: Changing the Game
entry.summary: Even if you don't game, the data is in, and the impact of the Steam Deck on Linux is massive. We'll go into details and then share our long-term review of the Deck. Special Guests: Alex Kretzschmar and Listener Jeff.

entry.title: 536: Grindr-in-Chief
entry.summary: The painful side of making video games, Grinder's big problems, and Google's sneakiest trojan horse.

entry.title: 528: Where's Your Data?
entry.summary: Today's theme is data sovereignty, and we'll check in with two crucial projects that are giving you more options. Special Guest: Noah Chelliah.
